Package polyglot.filemanager

The virtual file system that Polyglot uses for managing source files, intermediate files, and class files. This is used to hand off intermediate Java source files to the Java compiler. In the standard implementation, source files and output class files are mapped to the real file system, but intermediate files are kept in memory. However, extensions may provide their own file management if more decoupling from the file system is needed.
  • Interface Summary
    Interface Description
    FileManager  
  • Class Summary
    Class Description
    ExtFileManager
    FileManager implementation - A class that provides input and output access to the local file system.
    ExtFileObject
    This class represents a source object to be kept in memory.
